intro: Odontarrhena gehamensis, commonly known as the East African arrowroot, is a perennial herb native to the highlands of East Africa. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in montane grasslands and forest margins. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
